title: No sound from the pedal
body:
I have the 1.69" LCD board V1 and flashed the 1.0.5.2 release.
When connecting the development board to the pedal, there is some sound when booting (for one second) just like when connecting to a PC and after there is no sound from the pedal.
author: RuscaA

comments.body:
Hi. Check the direct monitoring setting in the Tonex software. It can be set so that the analog output is muted when USB is connected. 
A few people have had the same issue, Maybe I need to make an FAQ/Trouble-shooting page.
It worked. Thanks for the help!

title: No sound output for firmeware V1.0.4.2
body:
I am using s3-zero with the firmware V1.0.4.2. I can change the preset with my M-wave footcontroller, but there is no sound coming out from ToneX. Is there any settings on my Tonex OneI have to choose? I already set my toneX as Stomp mode, tried toggling on/off as well, but no help. 

The sounds can come out if I use it without any PCB. Please advise. Thanks.
author: Gilbertnghk

comments.body:
Hi. In the Tonex software, there is a setting for whether the analog output works when connected to USB. Monitor Mode or Direct Monitor or something, I can't recall the exact name.
Change that setting and it should fix your issue.
Thank you so much. It works now. Cheers

title: Request: 4 foot switches on Zero
body: Add support for 4 wired footswitches, which can control the presets just like the M-Vave Chocolate does. Preset 1,2,3,4. Switch 1+2 does bank down, 3+4 does bank up.
author: Builty

comments.body: Completed

Is the limitation on the 4.3 not having enough input ports?

The 4.3 with the edit interface and 4 foot switches would be awesome

Yeah the 4.3 uses a lot of pins for the display, and Waveshare only allocated 2 inputs and 2 outputs on the connector.

I've had a few other requests for more footswitches, like having 6 (2 dedicated bank up/down.)
I am thinking about adding support for an I2C IO expander. For about US$6 this would add another 16 inputs. And then having the web config able to select what each input does. 
I wouldn't be able to do this for a little while though. Curently rewriting the web interface to allow full parameter control.

Sure. There's absolutely no rush... I'm interested on the idea of I/O expansion.
Thank you so much for all the efforts and this brilliant piece of software

Thanks.
So the web interface is finished. I do want to look at adding USB Midi support, but I will also look at IO expansion soon.

title: Waveshare Zero + MVave Chocolate latest Version not working
body: Hello. Great project by the way. I could flash the latest client firmware on the ESP32 Zero, but the BT is not connecting. Tried the new beta in the Special folder. So now the Chocolate is connecting, but Preset changes are not possible. It is only possible to switch from A to B on Tonex One Pedal and with a step on Chocolate it changes back to A. But after that nothing else works. And I noticed that every time when I reset the Waveshare via the button the A/B of the presets on the Tonex Pedal are changed to another preset. Maybe you can help me.
author: miasei

comments.body:
Hi. Please set your Tonex pedal into Stomp mode. It sounds like its in A/B mode. 
The controller can only work in Stomp mode.
Ok. My bad! So that would be great if it is so easy. Will report if it works! Thanks for the fast reply!
Hey there again. Went home, stomp box on Tonex One and... yeah it is working! Thanks a lot again. Keep on the great work.
Great to hear!

title: Flashed from pre built release not working
body:
Hello,

Managed to successfully flash the Waveshare board and have the screen graphics etc. It also reads when I press the footswitch on the tonex however the previous and next buttons on screen don't change the preset on the tonex, only on the waveshare screen.

Any ideas? Fresh flash?
author: lcollins1989

comments.body: Update it will also show every preset as the same info.

Hi. Did you use V1.0.1.2? V1.0.0.2 had issues.

Is the USB connection icon on LCD grey (disconnected) or green (connected)?
If you press and hold the preset name, do you get the left/right arrows appearing?

Not sure if this is touch screen issue or USB issue.
Maybe try another USB cable. Make sure it supports data transfers and not just a charging cable. Power the Tonex off USB, without connecting 9v to it.

Hope that helps.

Ok step by step.

Reflashed, definitely V1.0.1.2.

USB Connection icon is green.

The left/right arrows are both visible, they only change the preset number but not the image or preset 'name'

If I press and hold the preset I go into the edit menu where I can change the image, write a description etc.

I've tried 3 seperate usb cables. I believe all 3 are data cables. I've also tried the one that came with the Tonex.

Powered via usb, not the 9V.

Occasionally when scrolling through the presets it will 'jump' to a different number (from 12 to 9 for example).

When pressing the footswitch on the Tonex it will toggle between two different presets on the LCD.
Powered by Usb? The recommended board had 1 usb port for tonex and needs 9v power.  Is it a different t waveshare with dual usb?
It's the same waveshare board recommended. Powered by 9v with the tonex powered and connected by usb to the waveshare.

Damn, sounds like everything is correct.
You running Tonex One firmware V1.1.4? 

Toggling between 2 presets on the LCD sounds like its in A/B mode. Super weird, the code forces it to stomp mode (slot C.)
Did you change the pedal back to A/B mode manually? Even that shouldn't matter.

It is very early for this project. I know of one other user who has it working OK so far.
Could be a possibility of some bugs.

Found the issue!

For some reason the tonex wasn't in stomp mode. Works great now!

Thank you

Thats great! I was almost out of ideas.

I am setting the pedal to use slot C as active, but maybe there is another part of the data that sets the actual mode.
I'll create a new issue for me to investigate if I'm missing this mode selection.
All is working as expected now I'm in stomp mode. Thanks again.
